body_html:
The following patch (commenting out all lines mentioning offsetof in depthwiseconv_uint8_3x3_filter.h):

anton@hikey962:~/CK_REPOS/ck-tensorflow$ cat package/lib-tensorflow-1.9.0-src-cpu/patch.linux/offsetof-off.patch
diff --git a/tensorflow/contrib/lite/kernels/internal/optimized/depthwiseconv_uint8_3x3_filter.h b/tensorflow/contrib/lite/kernels/internal/optimized/depthwiseconv_uint8_3x3_filter.h
index 8cd72239e9..a7c4cf8f76 100644
--- a/tensorflow/contrib/lite/kernels/internal/optimized/depthwiseconv_uint8_3x3_filter.h
+++ b/tensorflow/contrib/lite/kernels/internal/optimized/depthwiseconv_uint8_3x3_filter.h
@@ -76,7 +76,7 @@ struct DepthwiseConvParams {
 #define OFFSET_INPUT_HEIGHT 64
 #define OFFSET_OUTPUT_WIDTH 68
 #define OFFSET_OUTPUT_HEIGHT 72
-
+#if 0
 static_assert(offsetof(DepthwiseConvParams, input_depth) ==
                   OFFSET_INPUT_DEPTH, "");
 static_assert(offsetof(DepthwiseConvParams, input_row_size) ==
@@ -107,7 +107,7 @@ static_assert(offsetof(DepthwiseConvParams, output_width) ==
                   OFFSET_OUTPUT_WIDTH, "");
 static_assert(offsetof(DepthwiseConvParams, output_height) ==
                   OFFSET_OUTPUT_HEIGHT, "");
-
+#endif
 template <int32 kDepth, int32 kStrideWidth, int32 kStrideHeight>
 struct DepthwiseConvWindow {};

allowed me to complete the build on HiKey960:

anton@hikey962:~/CK_REPOS/ck-tensorflow/package/lib-tensorflow-1.9.0-src-cpu$ ck install \
--env.CK_HOST_CPU_NUMBER_OF_PROCESSORS=2 --rebuild
...
Environment entry added (89bab7b66c62ba7e)!

Recording CK configuration to /home/anton/CK_TOOLS/lib-tensorflow-src-cpu-1.9-compiler.python-2.7.13-linux-64/ck-install.json ...

Installation path: /home/anton/CK_TOOLS/lib-tensorflow-src-cpu-1.9-compiler.python-2.7.13-linux-64

Of course, it cannot be considered a proper fix, but I've committed it as a workaround to ck-tensorflow:package:lib-tensorflow-1.9.0-src-cpu. One can test it as follows:

$ ck install package:lib-tensorflow-1.9.0-src-cpu --env.CK_HOST_CPU_NUMBER_OF_PROCESSORS=1

(See full CK instructions above.)

body:
The following patch (commenting out all lines mentioning `offsetof` in `depthwiseconv_uint8_3x3_filter.h`):
```
anton@hikey962:~/CK_REPOS/ck-tensorflow$ cat package/lib-tensorflow-1.9.0-src-cpu/patch.linux/offsetof-off.patch
diff --git a/tensorflow/contrib/lite/kernels/internal/optimized/depthwiseconv_uint8_3x3_filter.h b/tensorflow/contrib/lite/kernels/internal/optimized/depthwiseconv_uint8_3x3_filter.h
index 8cd72239e9..a7c4cf8f76 100644
--- a/tensorflow/contrib/lite/kernels/internal/optimized/depthwiseconv_uint8_3x3_filter.h
+++ b/tensorflow/contrib/lite/kernels/internal/optimized/depthwiseconv_uint8_3x3_filter.h
@@ -76,7 +76,7 @@ struct DepthwiseConvParams {
 #define OFFSET_INPUT_HEIGHT 64
 #define OFFSET_OUTPUT_WIDTH 68
 #define OFFSET_OUTPUT_HEIGHT 72
-
+#if 0
 static_assert(offsetof(DepthwiseConvParams, input_depth) ==
                   OFFSET_INPUT_DEPTH, "");
 static_assert(offsetof(DepthwiseConvParams, input_row_size) ==
@@ -107,7 +107,7 @@ static_assert(offsetof(DepthwiseConvParams, output_width) ==
                   OFFSET_OUTPUT_WIDTH, "");
 static_assert(offsetof(DepthwiseConvParams, output_height) ==
                   OFFSET_OUTPUT_HEIGHT, "");
-
+#endif
 template <int32 kDepth, int32 kStrideWidth, int32 kStrideHeight>
 struct DepthwiseConvWindow {};
```
allowed me to complete the build on HiKey960:
```
anton@hikey962:~/CK_REPOS/ck-tensorflow/package/lib-tensorflow-1.9.0-src-cpu$ ck install \
--env.CK_HOST_CPU_NUMBER_OF_PROCESSORS=2 --rebuild
...
Environment entry added (89bab7b66c62ba7e)!

Recording CK configuration to /home/anton/CK_TOOLS/lib-tensorflow-src-cpu-1.9-compiler.python-2.7.13-linux-64/ck-install.json ...

Installation path: /home/anton/CK_TOOLS/lib-tensorflow-src-cpu-1.9-compiler.python-2.7.13-linux-64
```

Of course, it cannot be considered a proper fix, but I've committed it as a workaround to `ck-tensorflow:package:lib-tensorflow-1.9.0-src-cpu`. One can test it as follows:
```
$ ck install package:lib-tensorflow-1.9.0-src-cpu --env.CK_HOST_CPU_NUMBER_OF_PROCESSORS=1
```
(See full CK instructions above.)
